items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message: River levels on the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon and Dauntsey Brook remain high but are slowly dropping today. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads around Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham and roads near Reybridge. This Flood Alert will be removed tomorrow. The weather outlook currently shows more showers for the week ahead but no significant rain storms.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 10:27AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: High tides tonight and tomorrow may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible. Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Torksey Gauge are steady and pose a flood risk to low-lying areas and roads. Levels will remain high until 25/12/25. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00AM tomorrow 24/12/2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Soar in Leicestershire
items.message: Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road and Sileby Mill road, and farmlands at Cossington, Sileby, Barrow, Quorndon and Cotes. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge have peaked, but levels remain high. Levels will remain high until 25 December 2025. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:30 on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Churn and its tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message: Flooding remains possible. Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels along the River Churn remain high, particularly in Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is dry for Tuesday and Wednesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels. This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the lower River Cherwell. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue on the lower River Cherwell near Thrupp and Kidlington. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. River levels are falling slowly but we expect them to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Flood risk remains possible. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels along the River Windrush remain high, particularly in Bourton on the Water, Witney, Standlake and Newbridge. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the River Glyme. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue on the River Glyme at Woodstock. The river is now flowing within banks on the River Evenlode although water will remain in fields close to the river over the next few days. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days, particularly on the River Glyme.  

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, as the River Thames remains high. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. We do not expect the river to rise much further, however river levels will remain high over the coming days.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Hundred Foot Washes in Cambridgeshire and Norfolk

floodArea.riverOrSea: Old Bedford River, New Bedford River, Hundred Foot Drain, River Delph

items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23rd December 2025.
This information is correct as of 15:45 on Tuesday 23rd December. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 10 centimetre of water on the road. There are currently no issues on the Welney or Earith causeway. Due to uneven surface of the roads, water may be deeper in places.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 08:00 on Wednesday 24th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tern and Perry catchments
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 23 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message: River levels remain high but are falling, therefore the risk of flooding remains today, 23/12/2025. There is no further rain forecast. Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 11:00 on 24/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Flagham Brook, Swill Brook, Hankerton Brook, Hykemeres Stream, Derry Brook, River Key

items.description: Lower Frome and tributaries
items.message: River levels are still high but are falling slowly on the Lower Frome. Flooding may still be affecting low lying areas near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. No significant rain is forecast for today and river levels are falling slowly. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 24 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message: River levels remain high. Flooding is possible on 23 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today Tuesday 23rd December 2025 and over the next few days. 

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels will remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by by 10:00 on Wednesday 24th December 2025, or as the situation changes. 
Flooding is possible today Tuesday 23rd December 2025 and over the next few days.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Water levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett and surrounding moors. But with dry weather forecast for the days ahead.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. 
For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels.
Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the Parrett Relief Channel when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message: River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 23 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. Predicted peaks:- Mythe peaked at 4.13m on 21/12, Haw Bridge peaked at 4.97m 21/12. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Derwent

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today, Tuesday 23rd December 2025 and overnight.

Locations most affected will be local roads and low-lying land near rivers around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Wednesday 24th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today,  Tuesday 23rd December 2025 and overnight.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers in the Upper Derwent and Scarborough areas, including land around the Sea Cut at Scalby, Throxenby Beck, Old Malton, and Priorpot Beck in Norton.  

Levels are expected to remain high over the coming days and fall slowly. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Wednesday 24th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: The area at most risk is the Washford River which remains high. All other rivers in this flood warning area have now fallen below levels of concern. Drier weather is forecast for the next few days. We continue to closely monitor the situation and are clearing blockages from debris screens. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Take care and avoid walking, cycling and driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 24 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Bridlington
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
 
Flooding is possible from 8:00PM to 10:30PM on Tuesday 23rd December 2025. 
 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths, particularly around Bridlington South Beach and South Marine Drive. 
 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Wednesday 24th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn Vyrnwy confluence
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 23 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Cae Howel currently 3.71m and falling slowly.. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Tone and Parrett Moors
items.message: River levels are falling but flooding is possible for: Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is falling slowly (currently 7.28m). Water is no longer entering Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway as this level has dropped below 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 6.70m. Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. Drier weather is forecast for the next few days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping has commenced at Currymoor and will continue as and when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 23 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. Predicted peak:- Kempsey Yacht Club peaked at 6.03m 20/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent in Derbyshire
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding continues to pose a risk. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Shardlow Gauge and Willington Gauge have peaked and are falling, however the risk of flooding still remains. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Further rainfall is expected over the next few days which may see levels continue to rise. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the 23rd December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Piddle and tributaries
items.message: River levels have levelled off but remain high due to the recent heavy rainfall. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding could still affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. There is no significant rain forecast for today. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high from previous heavy rainfall. Flooding is still forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Frome, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around areas in East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham. There is very little rainfall expected today and river levels are slowly falling away. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Curry Moor and Hay Moor
items.message: High water levels are expected to cause flooding today 23 December 2025. Flooding may affect locations near the River Tone, Currymoor Main Drain (at 6.66m and falling), with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Cutts Road floods when the Currymoor Main Drain is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. There is a risk of water overtopping Haymoor flood storage area and affecting Curload and Stan Moor if this level reaches 8.30m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels. River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. Dry weather is forecast for the next few days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping has commenced at Currymoor and will continue as and when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames for Shiplake, Lower Shiplake and Wargrave
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Thames from Pangbourne to Purley
items.message: High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river in the area. Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, as the River Thames remains high. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. We do not expect the river to rise much further, however river levels will remain high over the coming days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels. This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Coln and its tributaries
items.message:
Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected, especially around Fossebridge and Bibury. The weather forecast is dry Tuesday and Wednesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00PM, midday, on the 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels remain high following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today, Tuesday 23rd December 2025 and overnight. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Wednesday 24th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Buttercrambe Mill
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Barlings Eau and Duckpool Catchwater
items.message: River levels remain high following recent rainfall, however we're expecting levels to gradually fall throughout today. Flooding is possible from the morning of Tuesday 23rd December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads, near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 1pm on the 24th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Minor Watercourses from Heighington to Dunston
items.message: River levels remain high following recent rainfall and continue to rise in Heighington Beck and Dunston Beck. Flooding is possible from the morning of Tuesday 23rd December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 1pm on 24th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Newport Pagnell to Sharnbrook
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message:
Water levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett and surrounding moors. But with dry weather forecast for the days ahead.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester, the Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding around Hainbury Mill, Ilchester.
Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message:
Water levels remain high on the River Parrett and surrounding moors. But with dry weather forecast for the days ahead.
Low lying land and roads are expected to still be most affected by flooding.
Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the (Sowy) Parrett Relief Channel when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Sharnbrook to Roxton

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cerne Valley
items.message:
Groundwater levels have begun to fall. We do not expect further flooding and the flood warning has been removed.  
Rivers and streams remain full due to high groundwater levels and will react rapidly to further rainfall.    
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.    
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. You are advised to take the opportunity to check any pumps are in good working order and that stocks of sandbags are replenished.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the Hooke
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 

Flooding is expected from the 23rd December 2025 onwards 

Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Hooke, Toller Whelme and Toller Porcorum. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 165m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and roads may have become damaged by floodwater. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the Sydling
items.message:
Groundwater levels have begun to fall. We do not expect further flooding and the flood warning has been removed.  
Rivers and streams remain full due to high groundwater levels and will react rapidly to further rainfall.    
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.    
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. You are advised to take the opportunity to check any pumps are in good working order and that stocks of sandbags are replenished.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the South Winterbourne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 

Flooding is expected from 23rd December 2025 onwards 

Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Winterbourne Abbas, Winterbounre Steepleton, Martinstown, Winterborne Monkton, Winterbourne Herringston and Winterborne Came. The groundwater level at the Kingston Russell borehole has risen to 118m, and is expected to continue rising in next few days. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Properties may experience flooding in cellars in affected areas. Flooding of roads is expected, Roads may be damaged by floodwater. intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
